# Project 2 - Comprehensive Module Plan: Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics Textbook

## Executive Summary
This document consolidates the detailed outlines for all 10 modules of the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics textbook (Model 2). Each module builds upon previous knowledge, progressing from basic ROS 2 concepts to complex integrated systems including humanoid robots, machine learning, and simulation environments.

## Module 1: Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2) - Completed in Project 1
Module 1 covered the basics of ROS 2 including nodes, topics, services, and basic implementation. This module is already completed as part of Project 1.

## Module 2: Advanced ROS 2 Concepts
This module covers advanced ROS 2 concepts including services, actions, parameters, and lifecycle nodes. Students will learn about advanced communication patterns, parameter management, and node lifecycle management that are essential for building complex robotic applications.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Advanced ROS 2 Concepts
2. Services in ROS 2
3. Actions in ROS 2
4. Parameters in ROS 2
5. Lifecycle Nodes
6. Hands-on Lab - Advanced ROS 2 Integration
7. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 3: URDF and Robot Modeling
This module covers Universal Robot Description Format (URDF) and robot modeling concepts including kinematics, dynamics, and simulation. Students will learn how to create, visualize, and simulate robot models with accurate physical properties.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to URDF and Robot Modeling
2. Links in URDF
3. Joints in URDF
4. Kinematics in Robot Modeling
5. Dynamics in Robot Modeling
6. Simulation with Robot Models
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Robot Model
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 4: Navigation and Path Planning
This module covers navigation and path planning concepts including SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), costmaps, and planners. Students will learn how robots navigate unknown environments and plan optimal paths to goals.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Navigation and Path Planning
2. Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM)
3. Costmap Representation
4. Global Path Planners
5. Local Path Planners
6. Navigation Tuning and Optimization
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Navigation System
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 5: Manipulation and Control
This module covers manipulation and control concepts including inverse kinematics, grasping, and trajectory planning. Students will learn how robots manipulate objects and plan movements with precision.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Manipulation and Control
2. Inverse Kinematics for Manipulation
3. Grasping and Gripper Control
4. Trajectory Planning for Manipulation
5. Force Control and Compliance
6. Manipulation Planning and Execution
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Manipulation System
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 6: Perception and Computer Vision
This module covers perception and computer vision concepts including sensors, point clouds, and image processing. Students will learn how robots perceive and interpret their environment using various sensing modalities.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Robot Perception
2. Camera Systems and Image Processing
3. Range Sensors and Point Clouds
4. Sensor Fusion for Perception
5. Object Detection and Recognition
6. SLAM and Mapping with Visual Data
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Perception System
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 7: Machine Learning for Robotics
This module covers machine learning applications in robotics including reinforcement learning and behavior learning. Students will learn how to apply ML techniques to robotic problems and develop adaptive behaviors.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to ML in Robotics
2. Supervised Learning for Robotics
3. Reinforcement Learning Fundamentals
4. Deep Reinforcement Learning for Robotics
5. Imitation Learning and Behavior Cloning
6. Learning from Human Feedback
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete ML System for Robotics
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 8: Humanoid Robotics Specifics
This module covers humanoid robotics specifics including bipedal locomotion, balance, and gestures. Students will learn the unique challenges and solutions in developing and controlling human-like robots.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Humanoid Robotics
2. Bipedal Locomotion Principles
3. Balance Control and Stabilization
4. Humanoid Kinematics and Dynamics
5. Gesture and Expression Generation
6. Whole-Body Motion Planning
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Humanoid System
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 9: Simulation Environments
This module covers simulation environments including Isaac Sim and Gazebo integration. Students will learn how to create realistic simulations for testing and developing robotic applications before deployment on physical robots.

### Module Structure
1. Introduction to Robotics Simulation
2. Gazebo Simulation Environment
3. Isaac Sim for Advanced Simulation
4. Physics Simulation and Accuracy
5. Sensor Simulation and Calibration
6. Simulation Integration with ROS 2
7. Hands-on Lab - Complete Simulation System
8. Module Summary and Exercises

## Module 10: Integration and Capstone Project
This module covers the integration of all concepts learned throughout the textbook and culminates in a comprehensive capstone project. Students will apply all previous knowledge to build a complex robotic system.

### Module Structure
1. Integration Concepts and System Architecture
2. Multi-Robot Coordination and Communication
3. Safety and Reliability in Complex Systems
4. Performance Optimization and Tuning
5. Testing and Validation of Integrated Systems
6. Capstone Project Planning
7. Capstone Project Implementation
8. Project Presentation and Documentation
9. Module and Textbook Conclusion

## Curriculum Alignment
All modules align with the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics curriculum, building skills progressively from basic concepts through advanced applications. Each module includes:
- Clear learning outcomes (2-3 measurable outcomes per chapter)
- Theoretical foundations with practical applications
- Hands-on labs with step-by-step instructions
- Exercises at varying difficulty levels
- Summaries and further reading references

## Implementation Strategy
- Begin with Modules 2 and 3 to build on the existing Module 1 (completed in Project 1)
- Ensure consistent chapter templates across all modules
- Maintain focus on pedagogical excellence and practical application
- Align all content with the hackathon constitution and requirements
